talk.author: did:plc:xc5j6qxxp4hpdeyyx5w6rhco
talk.utter: Just wait for the money-driven algorithm to kick in. We all know it's coming.

talk.author: did:plc:b62owfzpn4uch4wqu4vd5c4o
talk.utter: That wouldn’t actually be possible given the platform architecture. I mean, they could add one and default new users on the main app to it, but by design you could always opt out of it.

talk.author: did:plc:xc5j6qxxp4hpdeyyx5w6rhco
talk.utter: I'm happy to know that (and that's similar to what Hank said on his latest Delete This podcast), but if I'm convinced of anything it's the ability of people to find ways to monetize the un-monetizable.

talk.author: did:plc:xc5j6qxxp4hpdeyyx5w6rhco
talk.utter: Nicholas, is this similar to a social enterprise?

talk.author: did:plc:b62owfzpn4uch4wqu4vd5c4o
talk.utter: Unless there’s some other more specific usage I’m not familiar with (very possible, I am not a corporate lawyer), social enterprise is just the umbrella term for all of these types of business with nominally pro-social goals in lieu of/alongside a profit motive.

talk.author: did:plc:xc5j6qxxp4hpdeyyx5w6rhco
talk.utter: Yeah, I don't think there are strict boundaries on the term but could easily be mistaken.
